meanings.sent1: Be careful not to scorch your hand on the hot pan.
meanings.sent2: The sun can scorch your skin if you stay out too long.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally scorch the toast every time I try to make breakfast.
meanings.sent4: The fiery dragon's breath seemed to scorch the very air around it.
meanings.sent5: The candle flame danced and flickered, threatening to scorch the curtains nearby.

meanings.definition: A mark or area that has been burned or discolored by heat
meanings.sent1: The scorch on the table showed where the hot pot had been placed.
meanings.sent2: The scorch on the wall indicated a previous fire in the room.
meanings.sent3: The scorch on the cake made it look like a work of modern art.
meanings.sent4: The scorch on the map marked the location of the volcano.
meanings.sent5: The scorch on the grass revealed where the fireworks had landed.
